pullRequest.body:
- `OreLocalization.oreDiv_one_surj_of_finite_(left|right)`: if `S` or `X` is finite, then the natural map `X → X[S⁻¹]` is surjective
- `OreLocalization.numeratorHom_surj_of_finite`: if `S` is finite, then the natural map `R → R[S⁻¹]` is surjective
- `OreLocalization.cardinal_mk_le_max`: `#X[S⁻¹] ≤ max(#S, #X)`
- `OreLocalization.cardinal_mk_le`: `#R[S⁻¹] ≤ #R`
- `OreLocalization.cardinal_mk_le_lift_cardinal_mk_of_commute`: if `S` is commutative, then `#X[S⁻¹] ≤ #X` (I don't know how to remove the commutative assumption)
- `OreLocalization.cardinal_mk`: if `S` has no zero divisors, then `#R[S⁻¹] = #R`

Also the `[lift_]cardinal_mk_le` and `[lift_]cardinal_mk` for `Localization`, `IsLocalization`, `FractionRing` and `IsFractionRing`.

Also change the direction of the conclusion of the existing `IsLocalization.card` to match the docstring in file header. It is not directly used in any other files.

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [30a7a598a9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18004/commits/30a7a598a9f141818c72e0e3c4a424381eb3feee)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Cardinality | 1298 | 916 | -382 (-29.43%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Cardinality`|-382|
| `Mathlib.FieldTheory.Cardinality`|-16|
| `Mathlib.GroupTheory.OreLocalization.Cardinality`|771|
| `Mathlib.GroupTheory.MonoidLocalization.Cardinality`|775|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.OreLocalization.Cardinality`|797|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ cardinal_mk_le_lift_cardinal_mk_of_commute`
`+ cardinal_mk_le_max`
`+ lift_cardinal_mk_le`
`+ numeratorHom_surj_of_finite`
`+ oreDiv_one_surj_of_finite_left`
`+ oreDiv_one_surj_of_finite_right`
`++ lift_cardinal_mk`
`+++ cardinal_mk_le`
`+++++ cardinal_mk`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I notice that PR #18364 added `Cardinal.mk_fractionRing` which is the same as `FractionRing.card` in this PR.

Elsewhere I think the convention is to call this `Cardinal.mk_oreLocalization_le`.
If we really want to use `card` for this, we should rename `Cardinal.mk` to `Cardinal.card`, which is certainly out of scope for this PR.

Since it's the property of `OreLocalization`, I don't think it's a good idea to put it into namespace `Cardinal`.

The `IsLocalization.card_le` and `IsLocalization.card` is the existing result in mathlib which already uses this naming.
But perhaps you're right, the other results use different naming, for example [Polynomial.cardinal_mk_eq_max](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Polynomial/Cardinal.html#Polynomial.cardinal_mk_eq_max).
Perhaps we should call `OreLocalization.cardinal_mk_le_max`, etc.? But I'd argue that `card` is an abbreviation of `cardinal_mk`.
Pinging @b-mehta and @YaelDillies, who argued over this naming before.

Yeah, I find the combo `Finset.card`, `Fintype.card`, `IsLocalization.card` pretty poor. `IsLocalization.card_eq` could work, but really the function is called `Cardinal.mk` so `cardinalMk` is what you should use

`Finset.card` and `Fintype.card` are already functions, so I think they don't matter, and the results on them can be named as `card`. As for `IsLocalization.card`, I already renamed it to `IsLocalization.cardinal_mk`.

> `Finset.card` and `Fintype.card` are already functions, so I think they don't matter

I meant that their existence means that `IsLocalization.card` sounds like it should be a function
Is current naming (`cardinal_mk_XXX`) OK?
It's "ok" but the convention-approved name is `cardinalMk` 😄

> It's "ok" but the convention-approved name is `cardinalMk` 😄

Currently mathlib has no results named `cardinalMk` yet; all of them uses `cardinal_mk`. So I think it's OK to use `cardinal_mk` in this PR. Perhaps rename all of them to `cardinalMk` is for another PR.
I've opened #18808

```suggestion
theorem oreDiv_one_surjective_of_finite_left [Finite S] :
```

```suggestion
theorem oreDiv_one_surjective_of_finite_right [Finite X] :
```

```suggestion
theorem numeratorHom_surjective_of_finite [Finite S] :
```

Maybe 
```suggestion
open Cardinal Function
```
to avoid writing `Function.Surjective` everywhere?

Not a hard rule, but we usually do
```suggestion
# Cardinality of Ore localizations of rings

This file contains some results on cardinality of Ore localizations of rings.
```

Can you keep imports alphabetical?
```suggestion
import Mathlib.GroupTheory.OreLocalization.Cardinality
import Mathlib.RingTheory.OreLocalization.Ring
```

This is functionally equivalent to
```suggestion
alias FractionRing.cardinal_mk := Cardinal.mk_fractionRing
```

pullRequest.title: feat: add results on cardinality of localization
